title: President Nayib Bukele offers to solve security crisis in Haiti – 2024-03-11 07:17:31
text:
2024-03-11 07:17:31
“We can fix it (the security problem). But we will need a resolution from the UN Security Council, the consent of the host country and all the expenses of the mission to cover,” is how President Nayib Bukele offered his support to Haiti, which is in the midst of a security crisis at the hands of criminal structures.
The Salvadoran president has experience fighting crime in El Salvador through the public security plan executed by the National Civil Police and the Armed Forces, where he eradicated the gangs that kept the country under siege for decades.
The tycoon and owner of the social network
El Salvador went from being the most violent country in the world to being the safest in Latin America thanks to the implementation of the Territorial Control Plan and the emergency regime, which has allowed the capture of more than 75,000 gang members.
Currently, Haiti is under a scenario similar to that experienced by El Salvador in the past, where gangs have been attacking police stations, courts and prisons for several days, from which thousands of prisoners have escaped, which has caused concern among the community. international community.
The Haitian capital, Port-au-Prince, continues to be plunged into a spiral of violence unleashed by armed gangs that have hospitals under attack and have caused food shortages and blocked infrastructure. The city is immersed in an increasingly precarious humanitarian situation. Saturday was marked by new clashes between the police and criminal gangs.
